name: Guilford Courthouse National Military Park
description: "I never saw such fighting since God made me. The Americans fought like demons." - Lt. General Charles, Earl Cornwallis On March 15, 1781, six years into the American Revolution, General Greene and Lord Cornwallis' troops faced off at a small courthouse community. The battle would change the course of the Southern Campaign of the American Revolution.
shortDescription: "I never saw such fighting since God made me. The Americans fought like demons." - Lt. General Charles, Earl Cornwallis On March 15, 1781, six years into the American Revolution, General Greene and Lo...

operatingHours.description:
Start your visit at the Battlefield Visitor Center, located at 2332 New Garden Road, Greensboro NC 27410. The Visitors Center is open Wednesday through Sunday from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. These facilities close to visitors and motor vehicle traffic on Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Years Day. 

The park is accessible by foot, and visitors are welcome to walk the trails until dusk.

climate.weatherDescription: https://www.nps.gov/guco/planyourvisit/weather.htm Summers are warm to hot and humid with the occasional thunderstorm. Spring and Fall are cool with rainy periods. Winter is mild and cold with snow and ice possible in January and February. Wear comfortable clothing for the season and good walking shoes year round!

images.title: General Nathanael Greene Monument
images.altText: Bronze and granite monument of General Nathanael Greene on horseback
images.caption: The General Greene Monument is a focal point of commemoration on the battlefield

images.title: Hoskins' House and Kitchen
images.altText: Hoskins' House and Kitchen Located on the Grounds of the Colonial Heritage Center
images.caption: Hoskins' House and Kitchen Located on the Grounds of the Colonial Heritage Center

images.title: Historic New Garden Road
images.altText: A gravel path winds through a forest
images.caption: The Historic New Garden Road was a colonial highway and the location of the artillery during the Battle of Guilford Courthouse

images.title: 6 pounder cannons
images.altText: Two cannons on grey carriages (wheels) sit in a forest
images.caption: Anthony Singleton used two 6 pounder cannons like these reproductions at the American Third Line, the final battle point

images.title: 18th Century Field Drum
images.altText: 18th Century Field Drum at Guilford Courthouse National Military Park
images.caption: 18th Century Field Drum at Guilford Courthouse National Military Park
